page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The area consists of the city centre with its banks, offices, restaurants, department stores, theatres, cinemas, hotels and historical monuments; several large open spaces;a number of major centres of education an a belt of tenement housing(peculiar to Scotland) at its edges. the city centre divides into two parts - the medieval Old town of old buildings in narrow streets and the 18th century New Town with its planned wide streets fronted by the world famous Princes Street. The centres of government and law in Scotland are to be found at St. Andrews House and the Court of Session respectively. The area is a centre of tourism with Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood Palace and for shopping with two new shopping centres at Waverley and St. James.
